Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: op

Arguments.Name: --account
Arguments.Description: Select the account to execute the command by account shorthand, sign-in address, account ID, or user ID. For a list of available accounts, run 'op account list'. Can be set as the OP_ACCOUNT environment variable

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Output debug logs. Can also be set using $OP_DEBUG environment variable

Arguments.Name: --encoding
Arguments.Description: Use this character encoding type. Default: UTF-8. Supported: SHIFT_JIS, gbk

Arguments.Name: --format
Arguments.Description: Use this output format. Can be 'human-readable' or 'json'. Can be set as the OP_FORMAT environment variable. (default "human-readable")

Arguments.Name: --iso-timestamps
Arguments.Description: Format timestamps according to ISO 8601 / RFC 3339. Can be set as the OP_ISO_TIMESTAMPS environment variable

Arguments.Name: --session
Arguments.Description: Authenticate with this session token. 1Password CLI outputs session tokens for successful 'op signin' commands when biometric unlock is disabled

Arguments.Name: add
Arguments.Description: Add an account to sign in to for the first time

Arguments.Name: --address
Arguments.Description: The sign-in address for your account

Arguments.Name: --email
Arguments.Description: The email address associated with your account

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List users and accounts set up on this device

Arguments.Name: forget
Arguments.Description: Remove a 1Password account from this device

Arguments.Name: connect
Arguments.Description: Manage Connect instances and Connect tokens in your 1Password account

Arguments.Name: group
Arguments.Description: Manage group access to Secrets Automation

Arguments.Name: grant
Arguments.Description: Grant a group access to manage Secrets Automation

Arguments.Name: --all-servers
Arguments.Description: Grant access to all current and future servers in the authenticated account

Arguments.Name: revoke
Arguments.Description: Revoke a group's access to manage Secrets Automation

Arguments.Name: --all-servers
Arguments.Description: Revoke access to all current and future servers in the authenticated account

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: The group to revoke access from

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Issue a token for a 1Password Connect server

Arguments.Name: --expires-in
Arguments.Description: Set how long the Connect token is valid for in (s)econds, (m)inutes, or (h)ours

Arguments.Name: --server
Arguments.Description: Issue a token for this server

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Revoke a token for a Connect server

Arguments.Name: grant
Arguments.Description: Grant a Connect server access to a vault

Arguments.Name: --server
Arguments.Description: The server to be granted access

Arguments.Name: revoke
Arguments.Description: Revoke a Connect server's access to a vault

Arguments.Name: --server
Arguments.Description: The server to revoke access from

Arguments.Name: document
Arguments.Description: Perform CRUD operations on Document items in your vaults

Arguments.Name: --tags
Arguments.Description: Set the tags to the specified (comma-separated) values

Arguments.Name: --include-archive
Arguments.Description: Include document items in the Archive. Can also be set using OP_INCLUDE_ARCHIVE environment variable

Arguments.Name: --output
Arguments.Description: Save the document to the file path instead of stdout

Arguments.Name: --tags
Arguments.Description: Set the tags to the specified (comma-separated) values. An empty value will remove all tags

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Delete or archive a document item

Arguments.Name: --archive
Arguments.Description: Move the document to the Archive

Arguments.Name: --include-archive
Arguments.Description: Include document items in the Archive. Can also be set using OP_INCLUDE_ARCHIVE environment variable

Arguments.Name: events-api
Arguments.Description: Manage Events API integrations in your 1Password account

Arguments.Name: create
Arguments.Description: Set up an integration with the Events API

Arguments.Name: group
Arguments.Description: Perform CRUD operations on the groups of users in your 1Password account

Arguments.Name: grant
Arguments.Description: Grant a user access to a group

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: Specify the group to grant the user access to

Arguments.Name: --role
Arguments.Description: Specify the user's role as a member or manager. Default: member

Arguments.Name: revoke
Arguments.Description: Revoke a user's access to a vault or group

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: Specify the group to revoke the user's access to

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: Retrieve users that belong to a group

Arguments.Name: edit
Arguments.Description: Edit a group's name or description

Arguments.Name: --user
Arguments.Description: List groups that a user belongs to

Arguments.Name: item
Arguments.Description: Perform CRUD operations on the 1Password items in your vaults

Arguments.Name: --dry-run
Arguments.Description: Perform a dry run of the command and output a preview of the resulting item

Arguments.Name: --generate-password
Arguments.Description: Give the item a randomly generated password

Arguments.Name: --tags
Arguments.Description: Set the tags to the specified (comma-separated) values

Arguments.Name: --template
Arguments.Description: Specify the filepath to read an item template from

Arguments.Name: --url
Arguments.Description: Set the URL associated with the item

Arguments.Name: --fields
Arguments.Description: Only return data from these fields. Use 'label=' to get the field by name or 'type=' to filter fields by type

Arguments.Name: --include-archive
Arguments.Description: Include items in the Archive. Can also be set using OP_INCLUDE_ARCHIVE environment variable

Arguments.Name: --otp
Arguments.Description: Output the primary one-time password for this item

Arguments.Name: --share-link
Arguments.Description: Get a shareable link for the item

Arguments.Name: --archive
Arguments.Description: Move the item to the Archive

Arguments.Name: --categories
Arguments.Description: Only list items in these categories (comma-separated)

Arguments.Name: --include-archive
Arguments.Description: Include items in the Archive. Can also be set using OP_INCLUDE_ARCHIVE environment variable

Arguments.Name: --long
Arguments.Description: Output a more detailed item list

Arguments.Name: --tags
Arguments.Description: Only list items with these tags (comma-separated)

Arguments.Name: --expiry
Arguments.Description: Link expiring after the specified duration in (s)econds, (m)inutes, or (h)ours (default 7h)

Arguments.Name: --vault
Arguments.Description: Look for the item in this vault

Arguments.Name: provision
Arguments.Description: Provision a user in the authenticated account

Arguments.Name: --fingerprint
Arguments.Description: Get the user's public key fingerprint

Arguments.Name: edit
Arguments.Description: Edit a user's name or Travel Mode status

Arguments.Name: --deauthorize-devices-after
Arguments.Description: Deauthorize the user's devices after a time (rounded down to seconds)

Arguments.Name: delete
Arguments.Description: Remove a user and all their data from the account

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: List users who belong to a group

Arguments.Name: vault
Arguments.Description: Manage permissions and perform CRUD operations on your 1Password vaults

Arguments.Name: grant
Arguments.Description: Grant a group permissions to a vault

Arguments.Name: --no-input
Arguments.Description: Do not prompt for input on interactive terminal

Arguments.Name: --permissions
Arguments.Description: The permissions to grant to the group

Arguments.Name: revoke
Arguments.Description: Revoke a portion or the entire access of a group to a vault

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: The group to revoke access from

Arguments.Name: --no-input
Arguments.Description: Do not prompt for input on interactive terminal

Arguments.Name: --permissions
Arguments.Description: The permissions to revoke from the group

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List all the groups that have access to the given vault

Arguments.Name: grant
Arguments.Description: Grant a user access to a vault

Arguments.Name: --no-input
Arguments.Description: Do not prompt for input on interactive terminal

Arguments.Name: --permissions
Arguments.Description: The permissions to grant to the user

Arguments.Name: revoke
Arguments.Description: Revoke a portion or the entire access of a user to a vault

Arguments.Name: --no-input
Arguments.Description: Do not prompt for input on interactive terminal

Arguments.Name: --permissions
Arguments.Description: The permissions to revoke from the user

Arguments.Name: --user
Arguments.Description: The user to revoke access from

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List all users with access to the vault and their permissions

Arguments.Name: --allow-admins-to-manage
Arguments.Description: Set whether admins can manage the vault. Default: false

Arguments.Name: edit
Arguments.Description: Edit a vault's name, description, icon or Travel Mode status

Arguments.Name: --travel-mode
Arguments.Description: Turn Travel Mode on or off for the vault. Only vaults with Travel Mode enabled will be accessible while a user has Travel Mode turned on. (default off)

Arguments.Name: list
Arguments.Description: List all vaults in the account

Arguments.Name: --group
Arguments.Description: List vaults a group has access to

Arguments.Name: inject
Arguments.Description: Inject secrets into a config file

Arguments.Name: read
Arguments.Description: Read a secret using the secrets reference syntax

Arguments.Name: --file-mode
Arguments.Description: Set filemode for the output file if it does not yet exist. It is ignored without the --out-file flag. (default 0600)

Arguments.Name: -n
Arguments.Description: Do not print a new line after the secret

Arguments.Name: run
Arguments.Description: Pass secrets as environment variables to a process

Arguments.Name: --env-file
Arguments.Description: Enable Dotenv integration with specific Dotenv files to parse. For example: --env-file=.env

Arguments.Name: --no-masking
Arguments.Description: Disable masking of secrets on stdout and stderr

Arguments.Name: -f
Arguments.Description: Ignore warnings and print raw output from this command

Arguments.Name: --all
Arguments.Description: Sign out of all signed-in accounts

Arguments.Name: --forget
Arguments.Description: Remove the details for a 1Password account from this device

Arguments.Name: whoami
Arguments.Description: Get information about a signed-in account
